div.l: For Iohn saide Aleyn al so mot I thryve
If þat y may þe wenche wol I swyve
Som esement hath lawe shapen vs
For Iohn þer is alawe þat saith þus
That if aman in o thyng be agreved
Þat in Another he shal be releued
Our corn is stole sothly hit is nōn nay
And we haue had an evil fit to day
And syn I shal haue non amendement
Ageyns my los I wol haue esement
Be goddis sale it shal non othir be
This Iohn answerd Aleyn avise the
The myllere is a ꝑperlous man he saide
And if þat he out of his slepe Abreide
He myȝte do vs bathe a velony
Aleyn answerd I counte him not A flie
And vp he rist and to þe wenche he creep
This wenche lay vpriȝt ⁊and fast A sleep̄e
Til he so ny was or she myȝte Aspie
That it hadde be to late forto crye
And shortli forto telle þey were attone
Now pley Aleyn for I wil speke of Iohn
This Iohn lith stille a furlong wey or two
And to him self he made gret woo
Allas quod he this is a wickid Iape
Now may I say þat I is but an Ape
Ȝit hath my felow somwhat for his harm̄
He auntrid and his nedes spedde
And I ly as a draf sak in my bedde
And whan þis iape is told anothir day
I shal be holde a daffe · a cokenay
I wil arize and auntre me be my feith
Vnhardy vnseli thus men seith
And vp he roos and softli he went
Vnto þe cradil ⁊and in arm it hent
An bare it softe vnto his beddis feet
Sone aftir þe wif hir rowtyng leet
